alert.note: Alert for Randolph (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 9:10PM CST until January 13 at 10:00AM CST by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Arkansas... Black River At Pocahontas affecting Randolph County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Black River At Pocahontas. * WHEN...Until late Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Agricultural lands along the river and south of Pocahontas will be impacted by high water. Equipment and livestock should be moved to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CST Sunday the stage was 17.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 PM CST Sunday was 17.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 18.5 feet Monday morning. From there, the river is expected to fall below flood stage early Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.1 feet on 08/14/2013. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecast 12 AM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Crest Time Date Black River Pocahontas 17.0 17.9 Sun 8 PM 18.1 17.2 16.1 18.5 6 AM 1/10 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
